name: jira-oauth-example
description: This example simulates a nodejs client retrieving a JIRA issue via Oauth.  You connect your browser to the node server (running on port 8080 by default). Go to /session/connect, you will be redirected to JDOG where you do the OAuth dance, JDOG redirects you to /session/callback where the REST representation of JRADEV-8110 is then retrieved from JDOG (using the new freshly minted OAuth access token).
